website_summaries.verdict: The large version of casual pannier bags, when you need more space on a standard size bike rear rack.
pros: Fabric outer lining is water resistant in case of storms or other bad weather
The canvas materials can also withstand the usual types of punishment encountered on rides like dirt, scratches, and mud
cons: Bags can be difficult to strap on and take off of the bag due to the lack of proper mounting clips

customer_reviews.title: Voluminous
customer_reviews.text: Great commuting bags. The rear pockets hold all my repair tools, tubes, and pump. The bags, even folded, hold everything for my daily commute. A laptop fits easily in either the vertical or horizontal position. They hold an astounding amount of groceries on those days I stop and shop on the way home. If you're having issues with them rubbing the spokes, you have them set too far back on the rack. Set them forward on the rack and they secure easily with the strap-n-clips. The stitching is heavy-duty, too. I should have gone straight to these because I spent as much on two trunk bags that last all of two weeks each before the stitching tore.
customer_reviews.author: Matronista

customer_reviews.title: Good bags with some caveats
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Thick and sturdy fabric. Large capacity. Easy to clip on lights. Easy to strap on a large package on top. Very water resistant even when not using the included cover. CONS: I had to replace my existing bike rack with an "Ibera Bike Rack – Bicycle Touring Carrier with Fender Board, Frame-Mounted for Heavier Top & Side Loads" because the floppy bag would rub against the spokes of my rear tires if I hit a bump. Be sure you have a "side fender board" on your bike. Straps are loose and can easily end up in the spokes of your rear tire
customer_reviews.author: Eric van Bezooijen

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for the past month and a half or so on my 5 days/week commute to school. I love them. They have kept everything dry. The only time water gets inside is when it comes in from the opening when I drip water in there accidentally. It's so watertight once water does spill in there you have to dry it out, it won't leak out or absorb. Which is great because I put my computer, cellphone and costly textbooks in there everyday and have ridden through torrential downpour rainstorms with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mondoness

customer_reviews.title: Ruins wheels and causes injury
customer_reviews.text: This bag is poorly designed and poses a hazard to those who use it. This bag has no bottom support and insufficient back support, which means the corners of each bag curl into your back wheels. While riding, I came to an unexpected abrupt stop because the bags curled back into the rear wheel. I wasted a weekend sewing on a lateral strap in an attempt to resist this tendency of the bags...did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Rich King

customer_reviews.title: Functional & sturdy pack
customer_reviews.text: This bag has a very functional and sturdy design. I just made a bike packing trip across Michigan for 275 miles. I did not complete the trip but the bag was given to my friend to complete the trip. the bag help up well and has a lot of room and versatility. the bag fit snugly to my bike rack and the reflective strip made the bike a lot safer.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Donald

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time
customer_reviews.text: Had bags fully loaded with ultralight camping gear, had bag rip from tire first 2 miles. Needs to be redesigned, also the straps on top could use a different design along with the tops of the rear pockets cause if u load those pockets full, the lid doesnt cover the contents fully.
customer_reviews.author: Lynna

customer_reviews.title: Best panniers on Amazon, hands down!
customer_reviews.text: These panniers are near perfect; well built, waterproof, incredibly strong and sturdy, you can put a very full grocery bag on either side with room to spare and they are firmly attached to the bike, no worries at all about the bags shifting or falling off. Very attractive also, nice forest green, and shaped so as to avoid heel strikes while pedaling.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Austin

customer_reviews.title: Curls into the spokes
customer_reviews.text: I've had these bags for about 2 years and I commute 10 miles a day, 5 days a week. I love them with one major exception--after a while, the corners curl up into the spokes. I tried stiffening the bags with some stiff corrugated plastic board, but still it does curls up into the spokes. Oh, and also the straps are not easily adjustable. But I love the size and the outside pockets and the the reflective patches.
customer_reviews.author: chris wilcox

customer_reviews.title: Large, Durable, Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Very large. Durable fabric. The panniers collapse to a small profile when empty. My heels do not strike the front of the pannier when in motion. The pannier opens up to a very large capacity, long enough to hold frozen pizza & wide enough for gallon containers. This is everything I wanted in a pannier. The fabric is thick & looks to be capable of a very long life. This is a pannier well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: wayne papilio

customer_reviews.title: Not that difficult to install.  And tremendous capacity.
customer_reviews.text: The strongest bags to go with my West Biking 310# capacity rack. I can carry a heavy load in these bags. I will be hauling a fairly heavy load of lithium batteries and have no fear any issues. I can add as much additional load as I think I can handle. Very well designed and quite surprised how little effort to install after some of the comments. I would recommend these bags to any body that wants a strong high capacity bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jim-z

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second bag from this company. I'm very happy with the size (which Is huge at max capacity) and quality. People have complained about the bag losing shape and getting stuck in the spokes. This is not an issue if you have the correct rear rack that is meant to hold a pannier like this. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DDG

customer_reviews.title: Room for one more!
customer_reviews.text: What a great bag!!! I am worried I may be contributing to some slave labor, this looks like a much more expensive bag!!! What a good deal. I haven't used them in the rain yet but I have enough experience that I can tell they will do fine. Massive carrying capacity!!!
customer_reviews.author: Eva Lisa Behr

customer_reviews.title: Military look, tons of storage, but strapping not so well thought out.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look, I love the volume. I just wish they had an actual mount system. Also really really wish they didn't curl in towards the wheel when not loaded. I'm going to try and rig something to give it better shape inside to keep it out of my wheel, possibly a chunk of coroplast cut along one rib in order to form a stiffer back and fold into a shaped floor as well to make it more rigid in the base and back. Nice reflective material, love the quasi military look. Just don't stay in place and droop oddly after owning for about 6-8 months.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McElhineyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: these have been working pretty much perfect
customer_reviews.text: these have been working pretty much perfect. my only complaint is the plastic support on the rack side could be thicker, so it keeps the bag from curling around your rack a bit better. ill be adding corrugated plastic cardboard to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: I am happy to say they lasted my 1
customer_reviews.text: I am happy to say they lasted my 1,100 mile ride in the summer of 2015. I went solo from AR to NC.They proved worthy as they stood rain and sometimes even tear of the wheels as sometimes when it I got them full it would hit the wheel, but a little adjusting and it would work fine. Definitely will keep your stuff clean. I fell on mud once, and the outside got dirty but came off easily. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Juan  Mayen

customer_reviews.title: The Right Bag
customer_reviews.text: I was able to address the overhang with just a trip or two - this bag is the bomb, it's tough, waterproof, and really takes a pounding. I'm a everyday rider for some great distances and all kinds of terrain to and from several work locations, this bad boy bag can and does handle everything I and the journeys throw at it and some. This product will have a long life.
customer_reviews.author: Oba Kewsi

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room for gear or groceries
customer_reviews.text: Spacious, functional inside and back pockets. Easily removable from rack, if you dont overstuff it like I tend to do!! Comes with durable waterproof, elasticized cover!! Big enough for multiple backpacks—it does fade in the sun though
customer_reviews.author: Ladd E.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, I returned it but not because it’s not an awesome bag, it is. The quality is excellent and it holds an amazing amount. I commute to work on my bike and then have a long walk to my office, the bags are heavy and difficult to carry a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big capacity, secure, folds thinner
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be recently water resistant, but i added an extra treatment of water repellent to be safe. Very big, and very secure to my rack, yet have Velcro retention to narrow the bags down when not full. A nice unexpected touch!
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: I love that item
customer_reviews.text: Guys, I love that item! I went to grocery store to buy and store in the pack to see its full the belt doesn't fit but the magic tapes do it saves the day! I tested it can hold like 10 half gallons of milk on both sides, 4 bottles of water on the back, and 2 pizza boxes on the top. You can do the math. This item is very good and useful. If you guys plan to buy. Do not buy small. Buy the big like this one(45L) it is the best way IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for carrying two six-packs of gatorade
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my bike so I'll be able to go get groceries since I haven't got a car and it's working out great. Each bag can hold one 6-pack of gatorade with no issues, and I imagine you could strap another to the middle (which is also great for carrying pizza boxes). The added weight on the back surprisingly isn't an issue, in fact it almost makes riding a little easier. Overall I give this 5 stars. Well worth the price so far.
customer_reviews.author: Windows 95

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to remove as some other panniers but if you're ...
customer_reviews.text: Held up, overloaded over 250 miles of off road riding with no tears. Not as easy to remove as some other panniers but if you're looking for a sturdy cheap pair, they're good.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel K.

customer_reviews.title: Good panniers/bags with slight modifications
customer_reviews.text: I like the bags a lot. Very roomy. Even bought second set for second bike. Issues are rear of bags bent in and rattled on spokes, I added metal stiffiner which seems to be working any weight in the rear pockets probably will swing bag into spokes. Also all the Velcro get annoying. I also modified the closing strap/buckle (it was limiting) by cutting it. I was concerned about ease of getting off and on pleasantly surprised (did not use lower strap to rack) three quick buckles and your done. Bags are a bit bulky sometimes get in the way around tight spaceships for me is getting it to the area where I store my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bags. Tons of room, take all my groceries and work items in them everyday. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: These are the best bags I have ever seen!
customer_reviews.text: These bags are the best I have seen! They hold a lot, and fold down to a good traveling size, very very durable best purchase yet!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bags
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bags for computer, groceries or spare electric bike batteries, used heavily for 11 months now and they've held up, even after I cut off the red stars with a seam ripper (sorry comrades).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Allman

customer_reviews.title: It held a lot of gear but the combined system and lack of clips made it annoying to attach and take off everyday
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the large capacity. It held a lot of gear but the combined system and lack of clips made it annoying to attach and take off everyday. Also even when strapped properly, my gear would shift. Not sure if I was doing something wrong, but it was quite annoying considering my brother went with a cheaper system that had clips and worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used yet but appears to be exactly what I need
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Just as described.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it. It fits everything he owns.ok. maybe nit EVERYthing. The pockets are huge and just what he was looking for. 1 pocket fits his cowboy boit's and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Forest Nimph

customer_reviews.title: ... the Mickelson trail in South Dakota these bags worked great thank you
customer_reviews.text: I went on a trip to ride the Mickelson trail in South Dakota these bags worked great thank you. If there was a negative it was that i cold put to much wait in them.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Very nice..
customer_reviews.text: Very nice... Heaps of room and fits nicely on my bike rack. Took them on a 4 day cycling + camping trip - I could fit a few changes of clothing, some cooking equipment, food items and still had spare room.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the amount of room that is shared among the bags and pouches.
customer_reviews.author: Luc

customer_reviews.title: This looks like a Chinese military item and they wouldn't let me exchange or return it.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in October as a Christmas gift for my daughter. When she opened it, the item looked much more like a Chinese military item than what appeared in the photo. The color green in the photo is much brighter than the muted olive green of the actual product. It is also heavy and bulky. We asked to exchange it, but apparently since it was fulfilled by Amazon and I ordered it early, they didn't allow any returns. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Danzinger

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality, a pleasure to own
customer_reviews.text: Superior quality, a pleasure to own. Had to fabricate a dowel and zip tie solution to keep them out of my spokes as my rear fender is super cheap (and lightweight) and has no stays. Superior product, well done, thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Carly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, easy to install. Came with a yellow rain fly. Fits my Trek 3700 with a Sunlite rack just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan King

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Much bigger than I thought it would be. I can carry 5 grocery bags in it with the help of a bungee cord. I think it's easy to take off and put on, and it stays put even fully loaded. I've used it about a dozen times so far and it's been well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: These bags are crazy durable. Don't pass them up. The pictures don't truly show exactly how much they can hold (which is A LOT). Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Guy that Buys

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This exactly what i was looking for, its very sturdy and holds a lot of weight, folds up nicely alooks great this is the best carrier ive ever had a must purchase for any rider
customer_reviews.author: Donald Markus

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The are better than the regular pannier bags, heavy duty. They do weight more than the pannier bags.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Claycomb

customer_reviews.title: love this product
customer_reviews.text: love this product. We are able to put a full sack of groceries into each back and close it without products getting wet.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Hayes

customer_reviews.title: they're kind of like dry sacks where you roll up the mouth of ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems really well constructed and I think they should be fairly waterproof, they're kind of like dry sacks where you roll up the mouth of the sack. Storage seems more than adequate. I use a day pack to carry art supplies for painting and I can get it in one side and have the other for other supplies. I guess my only complaint is the instructions were very vague and mainly used photos. I know most racks are configured different they really didn't let you know how they thought it could be attached.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: too big for my small frame. gets caught up in the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: douglas benavidez

customer_reviews.title: Great Look
customer_reviews.text: These packs are great. They are cool looking and match my flat green bike. They expand to hold a lot of stuff and have a durable fabric.
customer_reviews.author: David Rosche

customer_reviews.title: Roswheel Bags are great
customer_reviews.text: These strap on. There are no instructions. They are huge and unwrap to be twice as tall as they currently are. This is what I wanted when I was shopping because my old panniers were too narrow and not wide enough. I wanted something for grocery shopping and camping so that's what I got. The day after I installed them I got rained on, hard. Everything inside was perfectly dry. Updated: the bags ended up being flimsy when empty so they curved toward my disc brake and wheel. Had to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Derick L.

customer_reviews.title: good quality very sturdy saddle bag
customer_reviews.text: Probably the quickest delivery iv ever had, good quality very sturdy saddle bag
customer_reviews.author: juan garza

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room, waterproof, but hard to mount.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room in these. Lots of pockets ... lots of options. The only downside is that they are hard to mount and unmount.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like those saddlebags a lot. They are perfect for me. And the cover is good also.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R.

customer_reviews.title: would be nice to have black color of this same model
customer_reviews.text: great bags but i would like same model in black color
customer_reviews.author: luckas

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is much bigger than I thought. Has lots of room
customer_reviews.author: dina

customer_reviews.title: I like that the bag is heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I like that the bag is heavy duty. I dislike that there is only one large opening, other then that I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: joseph landavazo

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart at the seams
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months literally falling apart at the seams...not just a little either...i dont care how big it is its really poor quality too...do yourself a favor and spend ur money on some buckets and pannier hooks instead.
customer_reviews.author: agrolove

customer_reviews.title: Gets caught in your spokes.
customer_reviews.text: I chose this pannier because it's waterproof and I live in a place that gets lots of precipitation. I've had this since September and I've been unsuccessful at keeping the pannier from getting caught in my spokes! So annoying. I've tried stuffing the pockets full and clipping them in the back, but both were unsuccessful. I will try what another reviewer did and see if putting some cut sheets of plastic inside to keep the pannier pockets from bending in toward my spokes. Also, if you're just a commuter, it can be a bit annoying to have to deal with all the straps this pannier has on it, just to put it on and take it off your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sure they're huge...
customer_reviews.text: but that's just what I wanted. I am a sketcher and am starting to sketch outdoors more often. These bags hold everything I need for a day excursion to sketch the area. It easily holds my drawing board, camp stool and my sketchbooks. If you are looking for something to carry groceries home, these bags are perfect. My recommendation is to get a couple canvas tote bags to fit inside the bags. The panniers are not exactly quick release. Some may find this a drawback.
customer_reviews.author: MBHill

customer_reviews.title: should work great!
customer_reviews.text: There no shortage of space in the bag, should work great!
customer_reviews.author: daniel higgins

customer_reviews.title: very easy to attach to rack
customer_reviews.text: Despite no instructions, very easy to attach to rack. Bags are huge!!!! Durable & so far waterproof!! Very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Carley Raven

customer_reviews.title: Needs slots for tie down straps
customer_reviews.text: Great value, lots of storage space, well made. My issue is that the bags are sewn together making it impossible to to lash items to the pannier rack or removing one bag at a time. If MFG added slots for straps to slip through and under the pannier rack this would be the bag set for me. Most cyclist use top racks to mount bed rolls, sleeping bags, tents and other bulky items.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Darker green than I expected, but it is working exactly as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Rupp

customer_reviews.title: Great but worried about quality.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these, one has been great, the other has had issues where the stitching is pulling out. Please let me know what I can do to resolve this. It has been a great pack, but I worry about the stitching holding. I hope this was just a one off issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bag sometimes hit the spokes while riding. Very heavy bag as well. Dear Buyer, This is ArcEnCiel on amazon,you bought this product from us. From your review,I am sorry you don't like it. Wish you could give us one opportunity to make this right,and we will try our best to complete our product. We cherish every review so much! And do hope you can re-consider and help to update the review to 5 stars just for our service, is that ok?Please........ We would be happy to send you a nice backpack for free,plis check the pic . I am waiting for your reply.... Sincerely, LONA
customer_reviews.author: Joe Brenner

customer_reviews.title: Good way to ruin your spokes
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews, I should have listened. I just spent my ride to work stopping a adjusting this bag over and over again to keep it from hitting my spokes. They need something much more study then the bendy plastic they put in to keep it stiff. No amount of strap pulling will keep them from curving into the rear tire. Save yourself the aggravation and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the fit.
customer_reviews.text: These bags are very well made; however, they did not fit my bike, an older 10-speed Mangusta, primarily in the contact of pannier and rack mount, so that the rear of the bag could jam into the spokes. I had to return them, which the seller happily accepted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bag will hit the spokes of rear tire
customer_reviews.text: This should come with a warning that you need to be creative to do something about preventing the bag from hitting the spokes of the rear tire. I tried to use it the day after I got it, and after a mile of riding my bike, the lower insider corner of the bag hit the spoke and I nearly lost my balance.... after reading reviews, I see that a lot of people are having the same issue and some folks have come up with very creative ways to prevent that from happening. The bag is exactly what I need and do not want to return it, so I will figure something out to make it work ...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, bulky, interfere with pedaling and spokes  and not meant for quick on/off attachment
customer_reviews.text: These panniers were very disappointing. They interfere with pedaling due to angle of pannier. In addition they do not fit just any rack....and are not stiff enough to maintain form and maintain be rubbed on spokes. Would not recommend for those wanting easy on or off attachment. They are bulky and heavy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy bag. Privacy better for folks over 6 feet
customer_reviews.text: Was never able to use this because it kept getting caught within my wheels. Very sturdy bag. Privacy better for folks over 6 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware buckles break.
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality plastic quick disco buckles. Broke one snap off of the buckle. $25 to re sew another new buckle. For this reason, Velcro should replace stitching for buckles. But other features are well thought out. Webbing to hold down larger cargo is very good. Entire grocery order for one person household easily fits.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: good quality, and i hope that it's waterproof as ...
customer_reviews.text: very big, good quality, and i hope that it's waterproof as the company says.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy them. Put anything in the bag and ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy them. Put anything in the bag and the back edge of the bag drags in the spokes. There is no interior rigid panel to prevent sagging
customer_reviews.author: George Staley

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy Materials - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: My husband rides to work 2-3 days/week. After about a month of use (maybe 15 rides) two of the plastic clips have broken. They hold the bag onto the bike. Without them the bags start falling into the rear wheel. The bag is totally non-functional. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bedard

customer_reviews.title: I cant tiè it to my bike without it slipping ...
customer_reviews.text: I cant tiè it to my bike without it slipping from side to side, &i ve got to cut out Wood ore the back, because the edge of it gose in to the bike spokes. I dont li ke it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge bags, no instructions.
customer_reviews.text: On the positive side the bags are enormous. I can get a bag or two of groceries into each side. On the downside is the complete lack of instructions. They do not fit on Blackburn bike racks very well. I had to replace mine with a larger rack. It takes a while or trial and error to get the bags to stay of the bike without getting caught in the spokes, falling off or having one side of the other drop down. After you get them firmly fixed in place (which takes a while), they are a pain to remove.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: THE very worst!
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst panniers I have ever seen. The problems are: 1.) not waterproof 2.) of very low quality, seams are coming undone 3.) my heel kicks the pannier on each revolution of the pedal 4.) the back corner of these panniers curl toward your bike tire and even broke one of my spokes.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Farley

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not great at staying on... The Velcro comes loose all the time...
customer_reviews.author: B-Money 1982

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and in good order - nib as described, no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ironhrt15

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It awesome I can if all my food there and easy to carry around
customer_reviews.author: jackie

product_meta.title: ArcEnCiel Bike Bag Bicycle Panniers Water-Resistant Large Capacity Rack Trunks Rear Seat Carrier Pack - Rain Cover Included
feature_bullets: Ultra-durable Retro canvas materials , rainproof , wear resistant , solid and durable ; Built-in PE board makes , shock resistant
Adjustable capacity : Up to 50L capacity , Maximum load 130 Pounds
Handle design in the top , convenient to carry ; With magic tapes to fasten , easy to adjust and install ; Two adjustable belt at top allows more equipment to load
Extra wide light reflective leather at back and side bags , safer for riding at night
Perfect for long journey ; Suitable for most of bicycle
